doc.after: After the metre was redefined in 1960, the kilogram remained the only SI base unit that relied on a specific physical artifact, the international prototype of the kilogram (IPK), for its definition and thus the only unit that was still subject to periodic comparisons of national standard kilograms with the IPK.[103] After the 1996â1998 recalibration, a clear divergence between the various prototype kilograms was observed.[citation needed]
